node.title: 'Enough is enough': have Collingwood and the AFL acted too late on violence against women?
node.alt: Jordan De Goey of the Magpies marks the ball during the round 17 2021 AFL match between Richmond Tigers and Collingwood Magpies.
node.description: Jordan De Goey has faced several charges ofÂ violence against women during his AFL career, but was not stood down by his club until last weekend.
node.content:
["Last week, AFL player Jordan De Goey was stood down indefinitely by Collingwood after being charged with forcibly touching a 35-year-old woman and assaulting a 37-year-old man at a rooftop bar in New York.\u00a0", "The charge of forcibly touching has since been dropped, while De Goey is due to face court on December 8 over the second assault charge, to which he has pleaded not guilty.", "It is the second time in the Magpie's career that he has faced serious charges of violence against women. Although both charges relating to women were ultimately dropped \u2014 the first just months before the latest incident \u2014 De Goey has not, until now, been formally stood down by his club or the AFL while being investigated.", "It's a situation that has angered many in the community, including fans, commentators and family violence advocates.", "\"I think the community sentiment is that enough is enough,\" said Catherine Ordway, a lawyer and Associate Professor in sport integrity and ethics at The University of Canberra.", "\"Whether it's back-chatting to the referee, speeding offences, drink driving or breaking curfew, these things are explained away, excused and brushed under the carpet.\"It shows the God-like, untouchable position that some of these men hold as members of the community... and they haven't been held to account.\"", "
NRL's 'no-fault stand-down'\u00a0policy sends a clear message
", "The fact that De Goey has played two seasons of AFL with serious allegations against him has also led to unfavourable comparisons with rival code NRL.", "In 2019, the NRL introduced a 'no-fault stand-down' policy after a string of allegations were made against its players involving violence against women.", "Under the policy, players are automatically stood down if they face serious charges that warrant a maximum jail sentence of 11 years or more.", "The NRL CEO and clubs also have the\u00a0discretion to stand players down when they are charged with criminal offences involving violence against women and children \u2014 regardless of the length of any possible sentence.", "", "
Former Australian Rugby League Commission chair\u00a0Peter Beattie (right) was an architect of the NRL's \"no-fault stand-down\" policy.(AAP: Joel Carrett)
", "At the time of implementation, former Australian Rugby League Commission chairman Peter Beattie said the policy was \"not about being popular\":", "\"Our job is to rebuild the reputation and protect the game. That reputation has been damaged by recent events. This is about a standard that's expected.\"", "The contrast between the codes' approaches raises a number of uncomfortable questions for the AFL. These\u00a0include whether it needs to implement a similar \"automatic\" stand-down policy, and whether it \u2014 or Collingwood \u2014 should have exercised its own discretion to stand De Goey down before the most recent alleged assault.", "
Decision to stand down De Goey may be 'too little too late'
", "On the back of De Goey's current charge, the AFL has supported Collingwood's decision to stand him down.", "\"The AFL takes seriously its commitment to building a safe and inclusive environment for women and a culture of respect, inclusion and equality,\" an AFL spokesperson told ABC sport.", "The spokesperson added that in cases where behaviour allegedly falls below those standards, \"we decide appropriate action, which includes the ability to stand down players\".", "According to Ordway, however, the fact that de Goey was available to play until now may be a case of \"too little too late\".", "\"I think you have to wonder what the message is that you're trying to send \u2026 on the one hand you can say, well the justice system in Australia maintains that you are innocent until proven guilty.", "\"The AFL is effectively saying: this is a criminal matter, it's not an on-field matter, and the appropriate prosecutory body is looking after it. Once the decision is made we will respect that and take action.\u00a0", "\"The difficulty with that is when you are also trying to send a message that you are a family-friendly, inclusive sport that respects women.\"", "", "
Through the AFL women's competition in particular, the AFL has sought to enhance\u00a0its reputation as a family-friendly, inclusive sport.(Getty Images:\u00a0Quinn Rooney)
", "This does not mean that the NRL policy is without its own difficulties. For example, Ordway pointed to the problem of relying on the justice system to provide adequate outcomes for victims, given the well-established difficulty of prosecuting sexual assault charges.", "\"Women know that they shouldn't bring these claims because they won't be believed and won't be heard.\"", "A related problem, she said, was that cases could drag through the justice system without a satisfactory outcome.", "This was true in the case against\u00a0Jack de Belin, who was stood down for over two years while he defended six charges of alleged sexual assault.", "One of those charges was dropped, while two separate juries could not reach a verdict on the other five charges. This year, the Director of Public Prosecutions opted not to pursue a third trial.", "\"That's really unsatisfactory for all parties,\" Ordway said. \"No-one would have said that was a good outcome. And certainly it didn't serve society.\"", "", "
Jack de Belin was stood down for over two years by the NRL under its no-fault stand-down\u00a0policy.\u00a0(ABC: Joel Carrett)
", "
Sport needs clear policies\u00a0to deal with nationwide emergency
", "Despite issues with both the NRL policy and justice system, lawyer and founder of Ladies who League Mary Konstantopoulos said it was important that sporting organisations\u00a0persisted with implementing policies to guide the standing down of players.", "\"One of the challenges for sports is, we've got a bunch of clubs that act in their own self-interest,\"\u00a0 Konstantopoulos told ABC Sport.", "\"So if a club makes a decision to stand a player down, it doesn't really have an impact unless the other clubs also make a decision not to sign that player.", "\"That's why I think it's really important that the governing bodies such as the NRL and AFL have a consistent stance and policy.\"", "Ms Konstantopoulos said it was also important to recognise that sports were not alone in dealing with the scourge of violence against women.", "\"We have a national emergency in this country when it comes to domestic violence and violence against women. So it doesn't really come as a surprise to me that we have these issues in sport given that sports are a microcosm of society.", "\"For me, when the no-fault stand-down policy came out, it made me proud, because while it certainly wasn't perfect, it signifies intention.", "\"I felt it was at least recognition by the NRL that these are serious offences, and that they have an impact on people who are watching the game.\""]
